ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course teaches basic to intermediate conversational skills in modern Greek.
We finished elementary grammar, ending the semester with the past tense. Learned reading comprehension, auditory comprehension, writing, speaking.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This was overall a great course but it must be said that the book we used was pretty annoying. Instead of giving you the chapter's vocab in a list or chart or picture, it interspersed it throughout passages and exercises, which made it a huge chore to go back and study. I ended up mostly just studying from my in-class notes. I would recommend using a different textbook in the future.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It's a fun class and it's usually pretty small so you get a lot of good practice in.
Would definitely recommend! Maria is great!! She makes the early mornings worth it. And with the small class, you really learn greek.
